wikipedia_page.main: Francis Noot Bacon (22 March 1862 - 25 January 1918) was born and died in Bedminster, Bristol. He was a director of Bristol City but was installed as temporary manager between October 1910 & January 1911 after the dismissal of Harry Thickett. In January 1911 Sam Hollis took over for his third, and final, spell as manager.Francis was also landlord of the Masonic Hotel in North St, Bedminster from 1897 until his death in 1918.Frank Bacon is the great-great-grandfather of footballer Mike Hooper.

response: Mike Hooper is the great-great-grandson of Frank Bacon, a one-time director of Bristol City, and the great-great-grandnephew of Canadian politician and King's Printer, Herbert Henry Ball.The Ball Family History The Lamb Family Web Page He has two children.
* Frank Bacon (actor) (1864–1922), American character actor and playwright
* Frank Bacon (football manager) (1862–1917), director and temporary manager of Bristol City F.C.
